professions.name: Husbandman
professions.detail: Smallholding farmer; manages a households fields/livestock (often tenant or free).

professions.name: Ploughman
professions.detail: Operates plough teams (oxen/horses) and handles heavy fieldwork.

professions.name: Reaper / Mower
professions.detail: Seasonal harvester cutting grain or hay during peak months.

professions.name: Dairymaid / Dairyman
professions.detail: Tends milk stock and makes butter, cheese, and other dairy goods.

professions.name: Shepherd
professions.detail: Herds sheep; manages grazing, lambing, and basic flock care.

professions.name: Swineherd
professions.detail: Tends pigs, often ranging them in woodland for mast (acorns).

professions.name: Cowherd / Neatherd
professions.detail: Tends cattle; drives, grazes, and watches the herd.

professions.name: Goatherd
professions.detail: Tends goats; provides milk, meat, and hides, often on rough land.

professions.name: Beekeeper
professions.detail: Keeps hives for honey and beeswax (wax used for candles and sealing).

professions.name: Woodcutter
professions.detail: Fells trees and prepares firewood and timber.

professions.name: Charcoal burner
professions.detail: Produces charcoal in pits/kilns for smithing and urban fuel.

professions.name: Thatcher
professions.detail: Roofs buildings with straw/reed thatch; repairs weather damage.

professions.name: Hedge-layer / Ditcher
professions.detail: Maintains boundaries, hedges, and drainage ditches.

professions.name: Carter / Teamster
professions.detail: Hauls goods with carts and draft animals; local transport labor.

professions.name: Fisherman
professions.detail: Catches freshwater or coastal fish for market and household use.

professions.name: Fowler
professions.detail: Traps/hunts birds for meat, feathers, and sometimes pest control.

professions.name: Trapper
professions.detail: Sets traps for small game and fur-bearing animals.

professions.name: Forester / Woodward
professions.detail: Watches and manages woods/game under a lords authority.

professions.name: Miller
professions.detail: Grinds grain into flour at a watermill/windmill; often a key village figure.

professions.name: Alewife / Brewer
professions.detail: Brews ale for household and sale; common domestic business.

professions.name: Baker
professions.detail: Bakes bread for sale; may use communal ovens where required.

professions.name: Butcher
professions.detail: Slaughters livestock and prepares meat for sale and preservation.

professions.name: Gardener
professions.detail: Tends kitchen gardens, herbs, and sometimes orchards for food/medicine.

professions.name: Wool merchant
professions.detail: Buys/sells raw wool and supplies cloth producers and exporters.

professions.name: Weaver
professions.detail: Weaves yarn into cloth on looms; core craft in many towns.

professions.name: Fuller / Walker
professions.detail: Cleans, thickens, and finishes cloth (often using fulling mills).

professions.name: Dyer
professions.detail: Dyes cloth with plant/mineral pigments; quality control matters for value.

professions.name: Shearman
professions.detail: Shears and smooths cloth surface to improve finish and appearance.

professions.name: Tailor
professions.detail: Cuts and sews garments; alters and repairs clothing for clients.

professions.name: Hosier
professions.detail: Makes/sells hose, stockings, and knit or sewn legwear.

professions.name: Furrier
professions.detail: Prepares and sells fur garments and linings; luxury-adjacent trade.

professions.name: Tanner
professions.detail: Converts hides into leather using pits and tanning agents (strong odors).

professions.name: Skinner
professions.detail: Prepares pelts/furs; often distinct from tanners in some towns.

professions.name: Cordwainer
professions.detail: Makes new high-quality shoes from fine leather.

professions.name: Cobbler
professions.detail: Repairs worn shoes and boots; sometimes makes cheaper footwear.

professions.name: Glover
professions.detail: Makes gloves and small leather items; sometimes also sells them.

professions.name: Saddler
professions.detail: Makes saddles, harnesses, and tack for riding and draft animals.

professions.name: Belt-maker / Girdler
professions.detail: Produces belts, straps, and sometimes metal-fitted girdles.

professions.name: Blacksmith
professions.detail: Forges tools, nails, fittings, and general ironwork.

professions.name: Farrier
professions.detail: Shoes horses and treats hoof problems; essential for travel and war.

professions.name: Armorer
professions.detail: Makes/repairs armor (mail, helmets, later plate elements).

professions.name: Helmsmith
professions.detail: Specializes in forging helmets and head protection.

professions.name: Bladesmith / Swordsmith
professions.detail: Forges edged weapons; may focus on swords and daggers.

professions.name: Cutler
professions.detail: Makes/sells knives and small cutting tools; often includes sharpening.

professions.name: Locksmith
professions.detail: Produces locks, keys, and security fittings.

professions.name: Nailsmith
professions.detail: Makes nails, rivets, and small iron fasteners in bulk.

professions.name: Founder
professions.detail: Casts metal objects (bells, cauldrons, fixtures) using molds.

professions.name: Pewterer
professions.detail: Makes pewter vessels and household wares.

professions.name: Goldsmith / Silversmith
professions.detail: Crafts jewelry, plate, and fine metalwork; handles precious metals.

professions.name: Mint worker
professions.detail: Works in coin production (striking, assaying, die-cutting), where a mint exists.

professions.name: Carpenter
professions.detail: Builds structural woodwork: roofs, frames, scaffolds, bridges.

professions.name: Joiner
professions.detail: Makes fine fitted woodwork: doors, chests, furniture, paneling.

professions.name: Cooper
professions.detail: Makes barrels, casks, tubs, and watertight wooden containers.

professions.name: Wheelwright
professions.detail: Crafts wooden wheels; precise joinery for carts and wagons.

professions.name: Wainwright
professions.detail: Builds and repairs wagons and carts (often with wheelwrights).

professions.name: Turner
professions.detail: Shapes bowls, spindles, and parts on a lathe.

professions.name: Mason
professions.detail: Builds in stone; major role in churches, walls, bridges, and great houses.

professions.name: Stonecutter
professions.detail: Cuts and dresses stone blocks; may carve details for buildings.

professions.name: Slater
professions.detail: Roofs buildings with slate; common where slate is available.

professions.name: Tiler
professions.detail: Makes and/or lays clay tiles for roofs and floors, depending on region.

professions.name: Plasterer
professions.detail: Applies plaster to walls/ceilings; interior finishing and repair.

professions.name: Painter
professions.detail: Paints decorative interiors, signs, heraldry, and sometimes religious art.

professions.name: Glazier
professions.detail: Cuts and sets window glass in lead cames; vital for churches and rich homes.

professions.name: Glassmaker / Glassblower
professions.detail: Produces glass sheets or vessels where workshops exist.

professions.name: Roofer
professions.detail: Installs and repairs roofing (shingles, tile, slate, leadwork by locale).

professions.name: Well-digger
professions.detail: Digs and maintains wells and pits; helps secure town/manor water.

categories.name: Pottery, household goods, and food trades

professions.name: Potter
professions.detail: Produces pots, jugs, bowls, and storage vessels.

professions.name: Chandler
professions.detail: Makes candles (tallow or beeswax) and sometimes sells lamp oils.

professions.name: Soap-boiler
professions.detail: Produces soap from fats and lye for laundering and cleaning.

professions.name: Baker
professions.detail: Produces bread for market; may be regulated for weight and price.

professions.name: Butcher
professions.detail: Slaughters animals and sells fresh/salted meat; controls offal disposal.

professions.name: Fishmonger
professions.detail: Sells fish (fresh, salted, or smoked) in markets and ports.

professions.name: Vintner
professions.detail: Makes, imports, or sells wine; often tied to taverns.

professions.name: Cook
professions.detail: Works in an inn, guildhall, or great household kitchen preparing meals.

professions.name: Spicer
professions.detail: Sells spices, imported condiments, and medicinal herbs.

professions.name: Grocer
professions.detail: Trades in bulk foodstuffs and imported goods (usage varies by region).

professions.name: Salter
professions.detail: Trades in salt and oversees salting/curing for preservation.

professions.name: Cheesemonger
professions.detail: Sells cheese and sometimes dairy provisions in larger markets.

professions.name: Mercer
professions.detail: Dealer in fine textiles, silks, and luxury cloth goods.

professions.name: Haberdasher
professions.detail: Sells small wares: pins, needles, laces, ribbons, and notions.

professions.name: Ironmonger
professions.detail: Retailer of iron goods and hardware: tools, nails, pots, fittings.

professions.name: Chandler (ship chandler)
professions.detail: Supplies ships with rope, tar, provisions, and gear (port towns).

professions.name: Merchant / Draper
professions.detail: General merchant or cloth dealer; drapers often specialize in cloth.

professions.name: Chapman / Peddler
professions.detail: Traveling seller of small goods from town to town.

professions.name: Carrier / Carter (long-haul)
professions.detail: Moves goods between towns by packhorse or wagon.

professions.name: Innkeeper / Hosteler
professions.detail: Provides lodging, meals, and stabling for travelers.

professions.name: Ostler
professions.detail: Cares for travelers horses; manages stabling at an inn.

professions.name: Shipwright
professions.detail: Builds and repairs ships and boats.

professions.name: Ropemaker
professions.detail: Twists hemp/flax into rope and cordage for ships and carts.

professions.name: Sailmaker
professions.detail: Cuts and sews sails; repairs canvas and rigging cloth.

professions.name: Stevedore / Dock laborer
professions.detail: Loads/unloads ships; moves cargo in and out of ports.

professions.name: Bailiff
professions.detail: Local official managing enforcement, rents, and administration for town or lord.

professions.name: Reeve
professions.detail: Manorial manager overseeing labor, dues, and day-to-day estate work.

professions.name: Beadle
professions.detail: Minor officer keeping order and assisting courts, guilds, or parishes.

professions.name: Constable
professions.detail: Keeps the peace; organizes watch and basic law enforcement.

professions.name: Town crier
professions.detail: Announces proclamations, market rules, and public news aloud.

professions.name: Clerk
professions.detail: Literate administrator handling records, accounts, and correspondence.

professions.name: Scrivener
professions.detail: Professional writer/copyist drafting letters, contracts, and records.

professions.name: Notary
professions.detail: Authenticates legal acts and documents (especially common in Italy).

professions.name: Advocate / Pleader
professions.detail: Represents clients in court; argues cases and drafts pleadings.

professions.name: Physician
professions.detail: University-trained medical practitioner (urban/elite clientele).

professions.name: Surgeon
professions.detail: Performs practical surgery: wound care, setting bones, minor operations.

professions.name: Apothecary
professions.detail: Prepares and sells remedies, herbs, and compounds for health.

professions.name: Steward
professions.detail: Senior administrator running household finances, supplies, and staff.

professions.name: Chamberlain
professions.detail: Oversees private chambers, wardrobe, valuables, and often accounts.

professions.name: Seneschal
professions.detail: High estate/household officer; coordinates management and justice by region.

professions.name: Marshal
professions.detail: Oversees stables, transport, and sometimes military organization.

professions.name: Constable (of a castle)
professions.detail: Commands garrison and security; manages fortress operations.

professions.name: Castellan
professions.detail: Keeper/governor of a castle on behalf of a lord.

professions.name: Butler
professions.detail: Manages wine and drink service; often a senior ceremonial office.

professions.name: Pantler
professions.detail: Oversees bread service and pantry stores for the hall.

professions.name: Ewerer
professions.detail: Provides basins/water for washing at table and manages ewers/linens.

professions.name: Carver
professions.detail: Carves meat at the high table; ceremonial service role.

professions.name: Master Cook
professions.detail: Leads the kitchen; plans menus and supervises cooks and servants.

professions.name: Larderer
professions.detail: Manages meat stores, salting, smoking, and pantry preservation.

professions.name: Spence / Spenser
professions.detail: Oversees provisions distribution; household purchasing/stores (regional term).

professions.name: Steward of the hall
professions.detail: Manages hall routines, seating, and household discipline.

professions.name: Porter
professions.detail: Controls gates/doors; regulates entry and deliveries.

professions.name: Page
professions.detail: Young attendant performing errands and learning courtly service.

professions.name: Squire
professions.detail: Attendant to a knight; maintains arms/armor and trains for knighthood.

professions.name: Groom
professions.detail: Cares for horses and stable equipment; general stable servant.

professions.name: Huntsman
professions.detail: Manages hounds, hunting gear, and organizes hunts.

professions.name: Falconer
professions.detail: Trains and cares for falcons/hawks used in elite hunting.

professions.name: Herald
professions.detail: Handles ceremony, messages, and identification by coats of arms.

professions.name: Minstrel / Jongleur
professions.detail: Performs music, storytelling, and entertainment at court.

professions.name: Knight
professions.detail: Mounted noble warrior owing service; leads retainers and fights in battle.

professions.name: Man-at-arms
professions.detail: Professional armored soldier/retainer serving a lord for pay/land.

professions.name: Sergeant-at-arms
professions.detail: Armed officer enforcing a lords authority; guard and household security.

professions.name: Archer / Crossbowman
professions.detail: Missile soldier using bow or crossbow (crossbow common on the continent).

professions.name: Captain (of the guard)
professions.detail: Commands the guard/watch; organizes patrols and defense.
